id: recurrence interval that is defined per a specific convention that determines how recurring days should be handled
name: recurrence interval that is defined per a specific convention that determines how recurring days should be handled

id: version of this ontology was revised to loosen domains on properties related to business day and day count (recurrence interval) conventions, eliminate a duplicate individual, normalize definitions to be ISO 704 compliant, eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC, move hasBusinessCenter to locations, where the class BusinessCenter is defined and merge countries with locations.
name: version of this ontology was revised to loosen domains on properties related to business day and day count (recurrence interval) conventions, eliminate a duplicate individual, normalize definitions to be ISO 704 compliant, eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC, move hasBusinessCenter to locations, where the class BusinessCenter is defined and merge countries with locations.

id: version of this ontology was revised by the FIBO FND 1.2 RTF in order to add definitions for business recurrence intervals such as the day of the month and week, and to revise the representation of the end of the month to correspond to the way that the other intervals are represented for use in parametric schedules.
name: version of this ontology was revised by the FIBO FND 1.2 RTF in order to add definitions for business recurrence intervals such as the day of the month and week, and to revise the representation of the end of the month to correspond to the way that the other intervals are represented for use in parametric schedules.

id: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the first preceding day that is a business day unless that day falls in the previous month, in which case that date will be the first following day that is a business day
name: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the first preceding day that is a business day unless that day falls in the previous month, in which case that date will be the first following day that is a business day

id: version of this ontology was revised to eliminate a remaining circular definition.
name: version of this ontology was revised to eliminate a remaining circular definition.

id: convention that specifies what happens when a date falls on a day that is a weekend or a holiday in one or more business centers
name: convention that specifies what happens when a date falls on a day that is a weekend or a holiday in one or more business centers

id: This ontology extends definitions of date and schedule concepts from the FinancialDates ontology with concepts defining dates that may be adjusted when they fall on weekends or holidays as defined in a given business center, for use in other FIBO ontologies.
name: This ontology extends definitions of date and schedule concepts from the FinancialDates ontology with concepts defining dates that may be adjusted when they fall on weekends or holidays as defined in a given business center, for use in other FIBO ontologies.

id:
This ontology was added to Foundations in advance of the December 2014 Long Beach meeting in support of the SEC specification. It is also needed to provide temporal relationships for Ownership and Control.

These three ontologies are designed for use together:

	* FinancialDates -- financial Dates and Schedules
	* BusinessDates -- business day adjustments
	* Occurrences -- occurrences (events) and kinds of occurrences

They are modularized this way to minimize the ontological committments that are imposed upon ontologies that rely upon them. Ontologies can import FinancialDates alone, or FinancialDates + BusinessDates, or FinancialDates + Occurrences, or all three together.
name:
This ontology was added to Foundations in advance of the December 2014 Long Beach meeting in support of the SEC specification. It is also needed to provide temporal relationships for Ownership and Control.

These three ontologies are designed for use together:

	* FinancialDates -- financial Dates and Schedules
	* BusinessDates -- business day adjustments
	* Occurrences -- occurrences (events) and kinds of occurrences

They are modularized this way to minimize the ontological committments that are imposed upon ontologies that rely upon them. Ontologies can import FinancialDates alone, or FinancialDates + BusinessDates, or FinancialDates + Occurrences, or all three together.

id: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the first following day that is a business day unless that day falls in the next calendar month, in which case that date will be the first preceding day that is a calendar date
name: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the first following day that is a business day unless that day falls in the next calendar month, in which case that date will be the first preceding day that is a calendar date

id: convention specifying that a date will be adjusted to the first previous day that is a business day
name: convention specifying that a date will be adjusted to the first previous day that is a business day

id: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the first following day that is a business day
name: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the first following day that is a business day

id: specific, recurring day of the week
name: specific, recurring day of the week

id: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the nearest day that is a business day -- i.e. if the non-business day falls on any day other than a Sunday or a Monday, it will be the first preceding day that is a business day, and will be the first following business day if it falls on a Sunday or a Monday
name: convention specifying that a non-business date will be adjusted to the nearest day that is a business day -- i.e. if the non-business day falls on any day other than a Sunday or a Monday, it will be the first preceding day that is a business day, and will be the first following business day if it falls on a Sunday or a Monday

id: identifies a convention for adjustment of the business day for handling weekends and holidays
name: identifies a convention for adjustment of the business day for handling weekends and holidays
